title: Food, Chemical and Biotechnology | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Gain skills to tackle complex issues in food manufacturing, pharmaceutical engineering, process safety and sustainability.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
As key growth areas, the food, chemical and biotechnology industries propel Singapore’s economy to new heights.

Be empowered to tackle complex issues and drive innovation in food manufacturing, pharmaceutical engineering, process safety and more. Through our courses you'll gain the confidence to champion sustainability and make an impact in eco-industrial development.
“This course is very useful and informative for individuals interested in process safety concepts, particularly for those who are interested in the development of safety cases.”
Next-Generation Food Innovation: Texture Development and Advanced Rheology
Learn theory in mechanics, rheology and biopolymer chemistry. Gain hands-on experience in extrusion basics and texturing a formulation using high-moisture or low-moisture extrusion.
CHE6020N01 The Human Factor in Process Safety
In this 2-day workshop, learn the importance of managing human factors to achieve improved safety in process industries.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations
Masterclass on Food Extrusion for High Moisture and Low Moisture Products
This hands-on course equips you with essential skills in extrusion technology to produce plant-based protein and innovative food products.
In this 3-day workshop, learn how quantitative risk analysis (QRA) can help in preparing for emergencies by identifying and evaluating possible accident possibilities.
Graduate Certificate in Process Safety Operations
Gain practical skills in fire risk assessment and computational fire modelling to improve building safety and design.
Graduate Certificate in Fire Dynamics and Fire Modelling
Towards Food Innovation, One Small Batch at a Time

Jointly launched by SIT, Enterprise Singapore and JTC in April 2022, FoodPlant, Singapore’s first shared facility for small-batch food production, has garnered interest from various food manufacturing players. One of them is SGProtein, a Singapore-based meat analogue manufacturer, who has partnered SIT and FoodPlant since 2021 through a series of student projects, Continuing Education & Training (CET) courses and manufacturing collaborations.
In a world shaped by constant disruption, lifelong learning is pivotal in nurturing innovative and adaptive workers, enhancing economic competitiveness and quality of life.
Subscribe now and receive our brochure for the latest updates on our courses, events and insights.

We look forward to journeying with you on your path of lifelong learning. You can manage your preferences or unsubscribe at any time through the links provided in our communications. To learn more about how SIT protects your personal data, you may refer to SIT's Personal Data Protection Policy

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
SIT reserves the right to make changes to published course information, including dates, times, venues, fees and instructors without prior notice.
Singapore Institute of Technology. All Rights Reserved.

Food, Chemical and Biotechnology
As key growth areas, the food, chemical and biotechnology industries propel Singapore’s economy to new heights.
Be empowered to tackle complex issues and drive innovation in food manufacturing, pharmaceutical engineering, process safety and more. Through our courses you'll gain the confidence to champion sustainability and make an impact in eco-industrial development.
“This course is very useful and informative for individuals interested in process safety concepts, particularly for those who are interested in the development of safety cases.”
Ong Seng Hong

updateCheckboxVal("Interest_BCD");
    updateCheckboxVal("Interest_ENG");
    updateCheckboxVal("Interest_FCB");
    updateCheckboxVal("Interest_HSS");
    updateCheckboxVal("Interest_ICT");

    function updateCheckboxVal(attrName) {
        if (attrName) {
            var checkboxName = attrName + "_checkbox";
            var intAttr = document.getElementsByName(attrName);
            var intCheckbox = document.getElementsByName(checkboxName);
            if (intCheckbox && intAttr) {
                intAttr[0].value = intCheckbox[0].checked;
            }
        }
    }

    function updatesUponSubmit() {
        var checkboxes = document.querySelectorAll('[data-group="check-box-group"]');
        var boxSelected = false;
        for (var i = 0, l = checkboxes.length; i < l; i++) {
            if (checkboxes[i].checked) {
                boxSelected = true;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (boxSelected) {
            var gmt8Date = new Date().toLocaleDateString("en-US", { timeZone: "Asia/Singapore" });
            const now = new Date().toUTCString();
            var optinEmailDate = document.getElementsByName("OptinEmailDate");
            var createdDate = document.getElementsByName("CreatedDate");
            var formSubmissionDate = document.getElementsByName("FormSubmissionDate");
            var primaryKey = document.getElementsByName("PrimaryKey");
            var getEmail = document.getElementById("email").value;
            var getWebsource = document.getElementById("websourceID").value;

            optinEmailDate[0].value = now;
            createdDate[0].value = now;
            formSubmissionDate[0].value = now;
            primaryKey[0].value = getEmail + getWebsource + gmt8Date;
			
            updateCheckboxVal("Interest_BCD");
            updateCheckboxVal("Interest_ENG");
            updateCheckboxVal("Interest_FCB");
            updateCheckboxVal("Interest_HSS");
            updateCheckboxVal("Interest_ICT");
			
        } else {
            var checkboxes = document.querySelector('.error-message');
            checkboxes.classList.add('active');
            return false;
        }
    }
